revision.comment: "persons" is legal jargon, not more precise

revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=August 2013}} {{DMCA|People|from|}} {{Infobox professional wrestler |name = Darren Young |image = Darren Young April 2012.jpg |caption = Young at the WWE SmackDown tapings on April 17, 2012 |alt= |names = '''Darren Young'''
Fred Rossen
Fred Rosser
Fred Sampson
Fred Sanford
Frederick of Hollywood
Officer Sampson
|height = {{height|ft=6|in=1}} |weight = {{convert|239|lb|kg|abbr=on}}{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/superstars/darrenyoung|title=Darren Young Bio|accessdate=December 28, 2011|publisher=[[WWE]]}} |birth_name=Fredrick Douglas Rosser |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1983|11|2}} |death_date = |birth_place = [[Union Township, Union County, New Jersey|Union Township, New Jersey]] |death_place = |resides = |billed = [[Miami, Florida]] |trainer = [[Dennis Condrey]]
[[Florida Championship Wrestling]] |debut = 2002 |retired = }} '''Fredrick Douglas "Fred" Rosser''' (born November 2, 1979) is an American [[Professional wrestling|professional wrestler]], currently signed to [[WWE]] under the [[ring name]] '''Darren Young'''. Prior to signing with WWE, Rosser competed in Northeastern and Mid-Atlantic independent promotions including [[Chaotic Wrestling]],{{cite web|url=http://www.chaoticwrestling.com/profiles/fuller_sampson.htm|title=Big Rick Fuller & Fred "Bonecrusher" Sampson|year=2008|work=Chaotic Wrestling Profiles|publisher=ChaoticWrestling.com}} [[East Coast Wrestling Association]],{{cite web|url=http://www.ecwaprowrestling.com/main/bios/frederick_of_hollywood.html|title=Frederick of Hollywood|year=2008|work=ECWA Current Roster Biographies & Photo Gallery|publisher=ECWAProWrestling.com}} Independent Wrestling Federation and the [[National Wrestling Alliance]]. He is the first WWE performer to disclose that he is [[homosexuality|gay]] while still active with the company.{{cite web|url=http://www.pwinsider.com/article/79636/cena-responds-to-darren-young.html?p=1 |title=Cena Responds To Darren Young |publisher=PWInsider.com |accessdate=August 17, 2013}} ==Early life== Rosser was born in [[Union Township, Union County, New Jersey|Union]], [[New Jersey]]. He began watching [[professional wrestling]] during the mid-1980s and became interested in becoming a professional wrestler as a teenager, wrestling in several [[backyard wrestling]] federations. He attended [[Union High School (New Jersey)|Union High School]] in New Jersey, where he played [[American football]], both offensively and defensively.{{cite web|url=http://www.miamiherald.com/2010/04/26/1599309/young-believes-hes-nxt.html|title=Young believes he's NXT|date=April 26, 2010|last=Varsallone|first=Jim|accessdate=July 23, 2010|work=[[The Miami Herald]]|page=1|archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5rRTktb1V|archivedate=July 23, 2010}} He attended [[Fairleigh Dickinson University]] where he played football for a year, before deciding to focus on his academic studies and professional wrestling. ==Professional wrestling career== ===Training and independent circuit=== Rosser became interested in becoming a [[professional wrestler]] as a teenager, wrestling in several [[backyard wrestling]] federations. He researched a number of wrestling schools before deciding on Camp IWF in [[West Paterson, New Jersey|West Paterson]], [[New Jersey]]. This was due in part to his employer, whose uncle was a friend of a local wrestler training there at the time, and helped him enroll in the wrestling school.{{cite web|url=http://www.ecwaprowrestling.com/main/superspotlight/ss-frederickhollywood-12-2006.html|title=Superstar Spotlight on Frederick of Hollywood|author=Martin, Josh|year=2006|month=December|publisher=ECWAProWrestling.com}} Rosser made his professional debut in 2002 and spent several years on the independent circuit, including wrestling for the Independent Wrestling Federation and [[Chaotic Wrestling]] during his early career. On May 17, 2003, he won his first major title when he defeated the IWF Heavyweight Championship in Woodland Park, New Jersey and held it for over half a year until losing to Roman on January 17, 2004. It was at a house show in Chaotic Wrestling that he was first noticed by promoter Jim Kettner and invited to compete for the [[East Coast Wrestling Association]] where he made his debut in the summer of 2004. Shortly after entering the promotion, Rosser began feuding with [[Prince Nana]] over the [[ECWA Mid Atlantic Championship]] and eventually defeated him for the title in [[Newark, Delaware|Newark]], [[Delaware]] on September 18, 2004. He lost the title to Nick Malakai less than two months later. ===World Wrestling Entertainment / WWE=== During 2005 and 2006, Rosser made several appearances for [[WWE|World Wrestling Entertainment]] (WWE) on its weekly programs ''[[WWE Heat|Sunday Night Heat]]'' and ''[[WWE Velocity|Velocity]]'' as well as in [[dark match]]es on ''[[WWE SmackDown|SmackDown]]'' and ''[[WWE Raw|Raw]]''.{{cite web|url=http://combat-hooligans.com/2007/12/05/iwf-wrestling-school-begins-9th-year-this-weekend/|title=IWF Wrestling School Begins 9th Year this Weekend|date=December 5, 2007|publisher=Combat-Hooligans.com}}{{dead link|date=December 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/news2006/1198785373.shtml|title=New episode of Pro Wrestling Ohio TV, 'CHIKARA' update + IWF events|last=Martin|first=Adam|date=December 27, 2007|publisher=WrestleView.com}} ====Developmental territories (2009–2010)==== In May 2009, Rosser signed a WWE developmental contract and was sent to WWE's [[Farm team#Professional wrestling|developmental territory]], [[Florida Championship Wrestling]], under the name '''Darren Young'''.{{cite web|url=http://www.onlineworldofwrestling.com/profiles/d/darren-young.html|title=Darren Young|accessdate=April 27, 2010|publisher=Online World of Wrestling}}{{cite web|url=http://www.miamiherald.com/2010/04/26/1599309_p2/young-believes-hes-nxt.html|title=Young believes he's NXT|date=April 26, 2010|last=Varsallone|first=Jim|accessdate=July 23, 2010|work=[[The Miami Herald]]|page=2|archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5rRU3hMWN|archivedate=July 23, 2010}} In FCW, Young was in a tag team called The South Beach Party Boys with [[Percy Watson]]. On February 16, 2010, it was announced that he would compete as part of the first season of ''[[WWE NXT]]'', mentored by [[CM Punk]].{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/WWE_News_3/article_39115.shtml|title=WWE News: Complete cast of the NXT show revealed including The Miz mentoring Bryan Danielson|date=February 16, 2010|last=Caldwell|first=James|accessdate= February 17, 2010|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch}} ====NXT and The Nexus (2010)==== {{See also|Nexus (professional wrestling)|l1=The Nexus}} [[File:The Nexus at SummerSlam 2010.jpg|300px|thumb|Young (far right) with the other members of [[Nexus (professional wrestling)|The Nexus]] at [[SummerSlam (2010)|SummerSlam]].]] On February 23, 2010, Young made his debut on ''WWE NXT'' with a character described as a "South Beach Party Boy", losing his debut match to [[David Otunga]]. His storyline had mentor CM Punk showing apathy towards him, claiming he had no idea why he's in ''NXT'' and did not want to train Young unless he accepted his Straight-edge lifestyle.{{cite web|url=http://www.411mania.com/wrestling/tv_reports/130807/411%5C%5Cs-WWE-NXT-Report-2.23.10.htm|title=411's WWE NXT Report 2.23.10|last=Bauer|first=Michael|date=February 23, 2010|accessdate=March 4, 2010|publisher=411Mania}} Despite this, Punk and his disciples, [[Drew Hankinson|Luke Gallows]] and [[Serena Deeb|Serena]], helped Young win his rematch against Otunga the following week.{{cite web|url=http://www.pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/TV_Reports_9/article_39503.shtml|title=Keller's WWE NXT Report 3/2: Competition explained, Cornfed Meathead debuts, Punk, Hardy, Regal, Jericho, Miz appear with Rookies|date=March 2, 2010|last=Keller|first=Wade|accessdate=March 4, 2010|work=PWTorch}} Young was ranked eight in the first Pros' Poll. After the pros' poll, Young decided to join the Straight Edge Society in an attempt to improve, only to change his mind before getting his hair shaved off. CM Punk decided to forgive him for standing up to him when he defeated Luke Gallows with Young's own hair on the line. Because of this victory, CM Punk had then been interested in Young's potential, but in turn started feuding with a jealous Luke Gallows. On May 11 in the second Pros poll, Young was ranked fifth out of the six remaining contestants and narrowly escaped elimination.{{cite web|url=http://wrestleview.com/viewnews.php?id=1273674387|title=WWE NXT Results – 5/11/10|date=May 12, 2010|last=Tedesco|first=Mike|accessdate=May 12, 2010|work=WrestleView}} The following week, however, Young was eliminated from the competition.{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwenxtreport/article_41412.shtml|title=Caldwell's WWE NXT TV Report 5/18: Ongoing "virtual time" coverage of NXT on Syfy Week 13|date=May 18, 2010|last=Caldwell|first=James|accessdate=May 19, 2010|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch}} The week following the Season 1 finale, Young, along with the other season one ''NXT'' rookies turned [[Heel (professional wrestling)|heel]] and interfered in the main event match on ''Raw'' between [[John Cena]] and Young's former Pro, CM Punk, and attacked both wrestlers, the announce team, and the [[ring announcer]] [[Justin Roberts]], before they dismantled the ring area and surrounding equipment.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2010/06/08/14303706.html|title=RAW: Vote early, vote often; NXT takes over|date=June 8, 2010|last=Plummer|first=Dale|accessdate=June 12, 2010|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} On the June 14 edition of ''Raw'' the rookies attacked General Manager [[Bret Hart]], when he refused to give them contracts.{{cite web|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/viewnews.php?id=1276572395|title=Raw Results – 6/14/10|date=June 14, 2010|last=Stephens|first=David|accessdate=June 22, 2010|publisher=WrestleView}} The following week on ''Raw'', [[Vince McMahon]] fired Hart and announced that a new General Manager had been hired, one that had signed all seven season one NXT rookies to contracts.{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_42106.shtml|title=WWE Raw results 6/21: Keller's report on the fallout from the Fatal 4-Way PPV event, Jericho puts his career on the line|date=June 21, 2010|last=Keller|first=Wade|authorlink=Wade Keller|accessdate=June 22, 2010|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch}} The following week, the group was named [[Nexus (professional wrestling)|The Nexus]].{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_42230.shtml|title=WWE Raw results 6/28: Keller's ongoing report on NXT-McMahon attack fallout, Sheamus-Cena confrontation|date=June 28, 2010|last=Keller|first=Wade|authorlink=Wade Keller|accessdate=June 29, 2010|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch}} On the July 5 episode of ''Raw'', The Nexus tried to attack John Cena as he confronted Wade Barrett during their "truce" with one another. The segment ended with The Nexus leaving without Young, when other Raw wrestlers arrived to aid Cena, and Young was assaulted by Cena to end the show. Due to Cena's actions, the new general manager pitted Cena in a 7 on 1 handicap match against The Nexus scheduled for the following week.{{cite web|url=http://wrestleview.com/viewnews.php?id=1278386787|title=Raw Results – 7/5/10|date=July 5, 2010|last=Stephens|first=David|accessdate=July 6, 2010|publisher=WrestleView}} Young however did not participate in the handicap match due to injuries caused by Cena the previous week, though The Nexus was successful in winning the match.{{cite web|url=http://wrestleview.com/viewnews.php?id=1278991411|title=Raw Results – 7/12/10|date=July 12, 2010|last=Martin|first=Adam|accessdate=July 14, 2010|publisher=WrestleView}} He returned on July 18 at [[WWE Money in the Bank|Money in the Bank]] with the rest of The Nexus, sporting a new haircut and costing Cena the [[WWE Championship]] against [[Sheamus]]. After the match, Cena attacked Young and fellow Nexus teammate, [[Tyrone Evans|Michael Tarver]].{{cite web|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/viewnews.php?id=1279507940|title=Money in the Bank PPV Results – 7/18/10|date=July 18, 2010|last=Martin|first=Adam|accessdate=July 21, 2010|publisher=WrestleView}} The Nexus continued to feud with Cena and the Raw roster, resulting in a [[Professional wrestling match types#Elimination tag team match|seven-on-seven elimination tag team match]] at [[SummerSlam (2010)|SummerSlam]]. Young was the first person to be eliminated from the match, when he submitted to [[Bryan Danielson|Daniel Bryan]] in under a minute, and The Nexus went on to lose the match.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/PPVReports/2010/08/15/15031141.html|title=Rumored return helps Team WWE fend off Nexus at SummerSlam|date=August 15, 2010|last=Plummer|first=Dale|coauthors=Tylwalk, Nick|accessdate=August 16, 2010|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} On the next episode of ''Raw'' the members of The Nexus fought in individual matches against members of the victorious Team WWE with the stipulation that losing a match would have them exiled from the group. Young chose to face John Cena but failed to win, and was exiled and attacked as a result.{{cite web|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/viewnews.php?id=1282015348|title=Raw Results – 8/16/10|date=August 16, 2010|last=Stephens|first=David|accessdate=August 18, 2010|publisher=WrestleView}} ====Singles competition (2010–2011)==== Young returned on the September 6 episode of ''Raw'', distracting Barrett and costing him a match against [[Randy Orton]].{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2010/09/06/15263156.html|title=RAW: Edge, Jericho fight to keep PPV spots|date=September 6, 2010|last=Plummer|first=Dale|accessdate=September 7, 2010|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} On the October 4 episode of ''Raw'', Young participated in a [[Battle royal (professional wrestling)|battle royal]] to determine the number one contender to the WWE Championship, but was eliminated by The Nexus.{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_44265.shtml|title=Caldwell's WWE Raw Results 10/4: Complete "virtual time" coverage of Raw with Hell in a Cell fall-out – John Cena joins Nexus|date=October 4, 2010|last=Caldwell|first=James|accessdate=October 5, 2010|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch}} Young had his first singles match since leaving The Nexus on the October 7 episode of ''[[WWE Superstars|Superstars]]'', but lost to [[Darren Matthews|William Regal]].{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2010/10/08/15624106.html|title=Superstars: Former tag team champions splitting up?|date=October 8, 2010|last=Johnson|first=Matt|accessdate=October 8, 2010|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} Young had his first win in singles competition on the October 14 airing of ''Superstars'' defeating [[Eddie Colón|Primo]].{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2010/10/15/15698241.html|title=Superstars: Divas, former Nexus member highlight show|date=October 15, 2010|last=Johnson|first=Matt|accessdate=February 18, 2011|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} Young team up with Tatsu in a losing effort against [[The Usos]] in mid November in two occasions.Young got his first victory of 2011 when he teamed with [[Primo Colon|Primo]], [[Yoshi Tatsu]], and [[David Hart Smith]] to defeat [[Zack Ryder]], William Regal, and The Usos on the January 13 episode of ''Superstars''.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2011/01/14/16883761.html|title=Superstars: All your favorites meet in 8-man tag action|date=January 14, 2011|last=Bishop|first=Matt|accessdate=February 18, 2011|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} ====Return to NXT (2011–2012)==== In March 2011, Young was selected as one of six former ''NXT'' contestants to return to the show in its fifth season, ''[[WWE NXT#NXT Redemption (season 5)|NXT Redemption]]''. During this season, Young was mentored by [[Chavo Guerrero, Jr.|Chavo Guerrero]]. In the season premiere, Young defeated Jacob Novak and won the first challenge to earn himself "redemption points".{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2011/03/09/17546731.html|title=WWE NXT: Redemption beings for 6 former rookies|date=March 9, 2011|last=Bishop|first=Matt|accessdate=March 9, 2011|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} On the April 12 episode of ''NXT'', Young attacked [[Titus O'Neil]] after their match and tried to attack O'Neil's pro Hornswoggle, but was stopped by Guerrero.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2011/04/13/17975401.html|title=WWE NXT: Show revolves around Maryse|date=April 13, 2011|last=Bishop|first=Matt|accessdate=December 28, 2011|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} He turned heel, when he attacked [[Hornswoggle]], and later he and Guerrero faced O'Neil and different tag team partners on several occasions. On the April 19 edition of Redemption, Young faced Hornswoggle in single match. During their match, Chavo Guerrero gave Young a blindfold but In the end Hornswoggle wins after a Tadpole splash. On the May 3 edition of Redemption, Young lost to his Pros Chavo Guerrero with Hornswoggle as a special guest referee. On the May 10 edition of Redemption, Hornswoggle didn't appear on NXT and accused by Hornswoggle Rookie's Titus O'Neil. The following week, It was revealed Chavo Guerrero kidnapped Hornswoggle and hid Hornswoggle in the box. Then, Guerrero and Young was attack Hornswoggle in the ring until O'Neil made a save. The feud was settled when Titus O'Neil and Darren Young faced each other in a No Disqualitication Match on the May 24 episode of NXT Redemption. The match ended with Titus O'Neil a victor after Hornswoggle interfered in a match which O'Neil attack Guerrero and Young. Guerrero was later released from WWE, leaving Young on his own. In August he formed an alliance with [[Derrick Bateman]] and the duo teamed up against O'Neil and ''NXT'' host [[Matt Striker]], but were defeated.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2011/08/03/18504436.html|title=WWE NXT: Striker back in ring following 4 year absence|date=August 3, 2011|last=Bishop|first=Matt|accessdate=December 28, 2011|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} Young then moved into a feud with Striker, defeating him on two consecutive occasions.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2011/08/10/18533821.html|title=WWE NXT: Kidd continues to shine|date=August 10, 2011|last=Bishop|first=Matt|accessdate=December 28, 2011|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}}{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2011/08/17/18565176.html|title=WWE NXT: Bateman gains a girlfriend|date=August 17, 2011|last=Bishop|first=Matt|accessdate=December 28, 2011|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} After Young attacked Striker following a handshake, [[William Regal]] intervened, saving Striker.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2011/08/24/18595176.html|title=WWE NXT: Kidd is show's shining star|date=August 24, 2011|last=Bishop|first=Matt|accessdate=December 28, 2011|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} Two weeks later, Young was defeated by Regal in a singles match. Young then formed an alliance with [[JTG]] and defeated Striker and O'Neil. After the match they were attacked by [[the Usos]].{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2011/09/14/18684876.html|title=WWE NXT: Regal, Striker want piece of JTG, Young|date=September 14, 2011|last=Bishop|first=Matt|accessdate=December 28, 2011|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} Young was suspended for 30 days on October 5, 2011.{{cite web|url=http://www.pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/WWE_News_3/article_54005.shtml|title=WWE News: Wellness Policy violation announced – NXT Rookie suspended for 30 days|date=October 6, 2011|last=Caldwell|first=James|accessdate=December 28, 2011|publisher=Pro Wrestling Torch}} Following his suspension, Young returned on the November 16, 2011 episode of ''NXT'' and assaulted Titus O'Neil.{{cite web|url=http://slam.canoe.ca/Slam/Wrestling/2011/11/17/18980366.html|title=WWE NXT: Curtis creating a rift between BetaMax|date=November 17, 2011|last=Bishop|first=Matt|accessdate=December 28, 2011|work=Slam! Sports|publisher=[[Canadian Online Explorer]]}} Young was then able to get the better of O'Neil twice in tag team matches.{{cite web|last=James|first=Justin|title=JAMES'S WWE NXT REPORT 11/23: Percy & Titus vs. Reks & D-Young main event, BetaMaxCurtis love triangle continues, Usos reference heritage|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwenxtreport/article_55466.shtml|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=April 9, 2012}}{{cite web|last=Walek|first=Gregory|title=NXT Results – 12/7/11|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/viewnews.php?id=1323461887|publisher=Wrestleview|accessdate=April 9, 2012}} The conclusion to Young's feud with O'Neil came when O'Neil defeated Young in a no disqualifications match.{{cite web|last=James|first=Justin|title=JAMES'S WWE NXT REPORT 1/18 – Week 46: Wedding interrupted, Titus turns heel, Elvis, out-of-control, destructive, and unproductive Cole commentary|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwenxtreport/article_57127.shtml|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=April 9, 2012}} O'Neil then turned heel and formed an alliance with Young. Young and O'Neil feuded with Percy Watson and Alex Riley in February 2012, defeating them twice.{{cite web|last=Walek|first=Gregory|title=Wrestleview.com – NXT Results – 2/1/12|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/viewnews.php?id=1328376231|publisher=Wrestleview|accessdate=March 22, 2012}}{{cite web|last=Walek|first=Gregory|title=Wrestleview.com – NXT Results – 2/29/12|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/viewnews.php?id=1330614237|publisher=Wrestleview|accessdate=March 22, 2012}} In March, while he and O'Neil were feuding with [[the Usos]], Young started chasing the affections of [[Sarona Reiher|Tamina]].{{cite web|last=James|first=Justin|title=JAMES'S WWE NXT REPORT 3/28 – Week 56: Kidnapping angle continues, very long backstage segment delivers, Uso main event|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwenxtreport/article_59659.shtml|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=April 9, 2012}} ====The Prime Time Players (2012–present)==== {{Main|Prime Time Players}} On the April 18 episode of ''NXT'', Young and O'Neil were signed by [[John Laurinaitis]] to the [[WWE SmackDown|SmackDown]] brand.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/videos/titus-oneil-shows-darren-young-a-contract-from-john-laurinaitis-wwe-nxt-april-18-26016063|title=Titus O'Neil shows Darren Young a contract from John Laurinaitis: WWE NXT – April 18, 2012 (1:00)}} The team made their debut for the brand on the April 20 episode of ''[[WWE SmackDown|SmackDown]]'' with a victory over [[The Usos]]. The team suffered their first team loss against the WWE Tag Team Champions [[Kofi Kingston]] and [[Ron Killings|R-Truth]] on the May 18 edition of Smackdown.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/videos/the-usos-vs-titus-oneil-darren-young-smackdown-april-20-2012-26016496|title=The Usos vs. Titus O'Neil & Darren Young: SmackDown – April 20, 2012 (1:43)}}{{cite web |url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/smackdown/2012-04-20/results/page-4|title=Smackdown Results |author=Michael Burdick |date=April 20, 2012 |work= |publisher=WWE |accessdate=April 21, 2012}} At the [[No Way Out (2012)|No Way Out]] pay-per-view in June, minutes before Young and O'Neil teamed up Darren Young to defeat Justin Gabriel and Tyson Kidd, [[Primo and Epico]], and The Usos in a four-way number one contender tag team match to earn a future shot at the [[WWE Tag Team Championship]], after [[Brian Jossie|A.W.]] turned on his clients, Epico and Primo.{{cite web |url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/nowayout/2012/fatal-4-way-tag-team-match|title=No Way Out - Fatal-4-Way tag team match results |author=Kara A. Medalis |date=June 17, 2012 |work= |publisher=WWE |accessdate=June 22, 2012}} On the July 16 episode of ''Raw'', Young and O'Neil unsuccessfully challenged Kofi Kingston and R-Truth for the WWE Tag Team Championship.{{cite web|title=CALDWELL'S WWE RAW RESULTS 7/16: Complete "virtual-time" coverage of live Raw #998 – MITB PPV fall-out, Cena's announcement|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_63388.shtml}} On the August 10 episode of ''SmackDown'', they defeated Primo and Epico in a number one contenders match via disqualification when A.W. provoked Kingston and R-Truth, who were on commentary, into interfering in the match.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/smackdown/2012-08-10/results-26043157/page-6|title=SmackDown Results: Del Rio ambushed Sheamus, taking the law into his own hands|date=August 10, 2012|last=Burdick|first=Michael|accessdate=August 14, 2012|work=[[WWE]]}} That same day, A. W. was released from his contract.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/wwe-superstar-aw-release-26044431|title=A. W. released from WWE|date=August 10, 2012|accessdate=August 14, 2012|work=[[WWE]]}} Prime Time Players received their title shots at [[SummerSlam (2012)|SummerSlam]], but were again defeated by Kingston and R-Truth.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/summerslam/2012/r-truth-kofi-kingston-prime-time-players-26044639|title=WWE Tag Team Champions Kofi Kingston & R-Truth def. The Prime Time Players|date=August 19, 2012|accessdate=August 21, 2012|work=[[WWE]]}} On the September 7 edition of ''Smackdown'', Prime Time Players defeated Primo and Epico and The Usos in a triple threat tag team match to earn another shot the Tag Team Championship.{{cite web|title=PARKS' WWE SMACKDOWN REPORT 9/7: Ongoing coverage of Friday night show, including Rey Mysterio & Sin Cara vs. Cody Rhodes & The Miz|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwesmackdownreport/article_64973.shtml}} However, on ''Raw'' three days later, Prime Time Players lost their title shot to the team of [[Daniel Bryan]] and [[Kane (wrestler)|Kane]] (soon to be known as [[Team Hell No]]).{{cite web|title=CALDWELL'S WWE RAW RESULTS 9/10: Ongoing "virtual-time" coverage of live Raw - Hart back in Montreal, final PPV hype|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wwerawreport/article_65047.shtml}} At the [[Survivor Series (2012)|Survivor Series]] pay-per-view, Young took part in a [[Elimination tag team match|10 man elimination tag team match]], but was eliminated by [[Rey Mysterio]].{{cite web|last=Caldwell|first=James|title=CALDWELL'S WWE SURVIVOR SERIES PPV REPORT 11/18: Complete "virtual time" coverage of live PPV - Punk-Cena-Ryback|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/wweppvs/article_66714.shtml|work=Pro Wrestling Torch|accessdate=November 19, 2012}} Young also competed in the [[2013 Royal Rumble]] entering at entrant 15 but was eliminated by [[Kofi Kingston]]. On the August 19, 2013 edition of ''Raw'', the Prime Time Players turned [[Face (professional wrestling)|face]] in a winning effort against the Real Americans. The face turn was done in part due to Young's [[Glossary of professional wrestling terms#L|real-life]] [[coming out]] to [[TMZ.com]] the previous week and the subsequent positive response by wrestling fans as well as the [[mainstream media]].{{cite web|last=Killam |first=Mike |url=http://www.wrestlezone.com/news/277001-prime-time-players-wrestle-as-babyfaces-on-raw-video-of-their-match-against-real-americans |title=Prime Time Players Wrestle as Babyfaces on Raw; Video of Their Match Against Real Americans |publisher=WrestleZone.com |accessdate=August 21, 2013}} ==Personal life== Rosser has cited [[Shawn Michaels]] and [[Ricky Steamboat]] as his favorite wrestlers. In an interview released on August 15, 2013, he publicly discussed being [[Homosexuality|gay]]. While [[WWE Hall of Fame]]r & current WWE creative consultant [[Pat Patterson (wrestler)|Pat Patterson]] and former WWE wrestlers [[Chris Kanyon]] & [[Orlando Jordan]] both came out as either gay or (in Jordan's case) [[Bisexuality|bisexual]] after either leaving the company or (in Patterson's case) retiring, Young is the first wrestler ever to [[Coming out|come out]] while still signed to a major promotion.{{cite web|url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/northamerica/usa/10245118/WWE-wrestler-Darren-Young-comes-out-as-gay.html |title=WWE wrestler Darren Young comes out as gay |work=Telegraph |date= |accessdate=August 25, 2013}} Later that day, WWE released a statement in support of Rosser for being open about his sexuality,{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/wwe-releases-statement-on-darren-young-26140515 |title=WWE releases statement in support of Darren Young |publisher=WWE.com |date=August 15, 2013 |accessdate=August 15, 2013}} and various fellow wrestlers [[Twitter|tweeted]] their support for him.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/inside/superstars-tweet-support-for-darren-young-26140583 |title=WWE Superstars tweet support for Darren Young |publisher=WWE.com |date=July 1, 2013 |accessdate=August 17, 2013}} He also revealed that he had a [[stuttering]] problem throughout childhood.[http://www.wwe.com/videos/playlists/darren-young-and-superstars-discuss-his-revelation-about-his-sexual-orientation Darren Young and Superstars discuss his revelation about his sexual
